docs.lead_paragraph: Anousheh Ansari is preparing to become the first woman to go into space as an amateur astronaut and the fourth private space explorer to buy a ticket to visit the International Space Station.

docs.abstract: Lenore and David Forsted letter on Johanna Jainchill's November 21 travel essay on visit to Israel
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: My husband and I have just returned from our sixth visit to Israel. Unlike the restricted visit that Ms. Jainchill had last spring, we toured all the sights of the Old City, prayed at the Western Wall (where a very moving bar mitzvah for a deaf boy was occurring) and walked through the tunnel under the perimeter of the wall (an extensive archaeological project that is a walk back through the centuries). We also went to three boutique vineyards near Jerusalem and tasted some outstanding wines.

docs.lead_paragraph: After a dip caused by the 1989 Army crackdown on the Tiananmen democracy movement, tourism is again soaring in China. According to the Government, a record 37 million foreigners visited China last year, up sharply from the previous total of 31 million in 1988, a year before the crackdown. Every indication is that numbers will go still higher this year. The bad news is that it is now difficult to reserve flights or make last-minute schedule changes. The days when a tourist could show up in Hong Kong and quickly arrange a 10-day tour of China are now over.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Singapore had 3.68 million tourists last year, 15.3 percent more than in 1986, the Singapore Tourist Promotion Board said today. In its latest bulletin, the board said that tourist spending for the year also increased by 21.3 percent, to about $2.35 billion.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A record number of foreign tourists, 15.6 million, spent a record amount of money, about $11 billion, in Britain last year, the Government said today.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: I read, with great interest, your article, ''New Efforts Seek to Tap County's Potential for Tourism'' [ Nov. 8 ] . And I agree that there is a real need to promote our historic and cultural locations.

docs.lead_paragraph: ''We have made great strides in creating a democracy that will be an example for all the world,'' Raphael Subervi Bonilla, Minister of Tourism for the Dominican Republic, asserted in New York City yesterday. ''Now we're asking you to help preserve it.''

docs.abstract: Min Lupis announces Govt plans further expansion of tourist indus; is in US studying ways of increasing number of Amer visitors
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans for an expansion of Italy's tourist business, already earning a record of $1.7-billion a year, have been announced by Gluseppe Lupis, the Italian Minister of Tourism and Entertainment.

docs.abstract: P J C Friedlander article on Mich State Univ's new tourism training program
docs.lead_paragraph: EAST LANSING, Mich. A dozen universities around the country are now training future generations of executives for the travel industry, executives who may never be able to boast that they started their careers washing dishes, smashing baggage or hustling ice water.
